On-Demand Video Library

Use this page to setup and edit your video content.

https://www.youtube.com/channel/

You don´t know your Youtube Channel ID? This help doc from Google describes how to find your Channel ID.

Tappla does NOT do the video hosting. Instead we stream your videos from Vimeo to your TV app

Note: If you like your account and would like to move forward, then you need to use Vimeo Pro as a streaming source for your on-demand videos.

Do you want to show all videos of your channel or just some specific videos? *

We recommend you organize your videos in playlists. Then you can select the `multiple playlists` layout and the videos of each playlist are then displayed in a separate horizontal row. Above each horizontal row your playlist title also displayed. In case you do not want to organize your videos in playlists, then select `all videos / no playlists`. All your videos will then appear inside your app.

AUTOPLAY
Note: We auto update your video feed every 1-2 hours. That´s why you don´t see changes in your app on Apple TV instantly. It can take up to 2 hours to show up. Your video feed was last updated: 2021-01-05 22:57:55 autoupdate within the next 2 hours - active)
MRSS feed for Amazon Fire TV

With the MRSS feed above you can create your own custom Amazon Fire TV app that includes your on-demand videos from Vimeo and your live stream URL (optional).

This feature is currently only available for Fire TV. Roku will be released soon. For Apple TV use our native app builder.

Copy the feed URL below and enter it during the setup process at Amazon Creator.

For more info check out our help article: http://help.tappla.com/en/articles/4304878-how-to-set-up-your-fire-tv-app
